etymology: From Ottoman Turkish ایو (eyü, “good, well”), from Old Anatolian Turkish ایكو (eygü, “good”), from Proto-Turkic *ed-gü (“good, excellent”), derived from Proto-Turkic *ed (“thing, goods”). Compare Karakhanid [script needed] (eδ, “refined, useful thing”) and Mongolian эд (ed, “thing, object, item, property”), a Turkic borrowing.
